department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: This solicitation is seeking proposals from Offerors to provide up to 100,600 MWh of Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs) per year, for a period of 20 years to all participating Government of Canada organizations.
full_summary:
===============

### Tender Notice

**Title:** National Renewable Energy Certificates
**Solicitation Number:** WS3966220571
**Publication Date:** April 26, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** September 26, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT

**Amendment Number:** 1
**Amendment Date:** September 12, 2023

**Background:**
This solicitation of offers cancels and supersedes the previous solicitation of offers number EP959-211948/C dated January 12, 2022, with a closing of June 2, 2022, at 2:00 PM EDT. A debriefing or feedback session will be provided upon request to Offerors who offered on the previous solicitation.

**Scope of Work:**
Canada is seeking offers from Offerors to provide up to 100,600 MWh of Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs) per year for a period of 20 years to all participating Government of Canada organizations.

**Deliveries:**
The solicitation is open to deliveries to Alberta.

**Officer Contact:**
Tyler Zdan (SPAC/PSPC) at tyler.zdan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Notice URL:**
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16110017?extsite=MTYxMTAwMTdfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**CITA IDs:**
*83101801* *Supply of single phase electricity*
*83101802* *Supply of two phase electricity*
*83101803* *Supply of three phase electricity*

### Tendering Procedure

* Tenders must be submitted by September 26, 2023, at 15:00 HAE.
* Late bids will be deemed non-responsible.
* Bidders must submit all supporting documentation and bid submissions by the deadline.

### Trade Agreements:
This solicitation is open to bidders from the following countries: Australia, Canada, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, European Union, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Israel + West Bank and Gaza Strip, Liechtenstein, Mexico, Morocco, New Zealand, Norway, Panama, Peru, Singapore, South Korea, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States, and Uruguay.

Note: I kept the CITA IDS as it appears in the original document, but I wanted to know if you prefer for it to be in a different order of categories.
Would
